intro: Chlorogalum purpureum var. reductum, commonly known as the purple sandverbena, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of gray-green, fleshy leaves. The plant produces striking purple or pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal sage scrub habitats. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
